title: Prohibiting Certain Imports, Exports, and New Investment With Respect to Continued Russian Federation Aggression

enrichment.summary: This executive order prohibits importing certain Russian products into the United States and restricts the export of luxury goods, new investments, and U.S. dollar banknotes to Russia. It aims to increase economic pressure on the Russian government in response to ongoing aggression. The order also forbids actions that try to evade these restrictions and allows the U.S. government to enforce and regulate these prohibitions.
potential_concerns: The prohibition on importing Russian fish, seafood, and alcoholic beverages could significantly harm seafood fishery workers and related businesses involved in importation and distribution.

Restrictions on new investments in Russia by U.S. persons may adversely affect U.S.-based corporations and investors who have existing or planned business interests, potentially leading to financial losses.

The export ban on luxury goods and U.S. dollar banknotes to Russia may have limited direct positive impact but could complicate compliance for U.S. exporters, increasing legal risk for corporations and investors.

Evasion and circumvention enforcement measures may impose heightened compliance costs and penalties on U.S. businesses engaging in international trade, potentially reducing competitiveness and operational flexibility.
